* The Garfield class is the main entry point for the Garfield chatbot application.
* It initializes the necessary components (UI, Storage, TaskList) and handles
* the main event loop for user interaction.
* @param saveFilePath The file path where tasks are saved and loaded from.
* Starts the Garfield chatbot, showing a greeting message, processing user
* commands in a loop, and showing an ending message before exiting.
* The main method, which serves as the entry point of the Garfield application.
* @param args Command-line arguments passed to the application (not used).
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* The AddCommand class represents a command to add a new task to the task list
* Constructs a new AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Executes the AddCommand by adding the task to the task list, displaying a
* message to the user, and saving the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks The TaskList to which the task will be added.
* @param ui The Ui object used to interact with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save the updated task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Fine. I'll add '" + task.getTaskDescription() + "' to the list.\n\n\t"
+ this.task + "\n\nJust what you needed to boost your list to a grand total of "

* The Command class serves as an abstract base class for all user commands
* in the Garfield chatbot application. Each specific command will extend
* this class and implement its own behavior.
* This constructor is typically invoked by subclasses.
* Returns whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return {@code true} if the application should exit after this command,
*         {@code false} otherwise. The default implementation returns {@code false}.
* Executes the command with the given TaskList, Ui, and Storage.
* Subclasses should override this method to provide specific command behavior.
* @param tasks The TaskList that the command will operate on.
* @param ui The Ui object used to interact with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save or load tasks.
* @throws GarfieldException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GarfieldException;
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage) throws GarfieldException;
